metadata.title: CVE-2020-10729 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the use of insufficiently random values in Ansible. Tworandom password lookups of the same length generate the equal value as thetemplate caching action for the same file since no re-evaluation happens.The highest threat from this vulnerability would be that all passwords areexposed at once for the file. This flaw affects Ansible Engine versionsbefore 2.9.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.9.6+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.6+dfsg-1').
